verses.verse: Do they not go astray who devise evil? But mercy and truth belong to those who devise good.
In all labor there is profit, But idle chatter leads only to poverty.
The crown of the wise is their riches, But the foolishness of fools is folly.
A true witness delivers ((Ezek. 3:18-21)) souls, But a deceitful witness speaks lies.
In the fear of the LORD there is strong confidence, And His children will have a place of refuge.
(Prov. 13:14) The fear of the LORD is a fountain of life, To turn one away from the snares of death.
In a multitude of people is a king’s honor, But in the lack of people is the downfall of a prince.
(Prov. 16:32; 19:11; Eccl. 7:9; James 1:19) He who is slow to wrath has great understanding, But he who is impulsive exalts folly.
A sound heart is life to the body, But (Ps. 112:10) envy is (Prov. 12:4; Hab. 3:16) rottenness to the bones.
(Prov. 17:5; Matt. 25:40; 1 John 3:17) He who oppresses the poor reproaches ((Job 31:15; Prov. 22:2)) his Maker, But he who honors Him has mercy on the needy.
The wicked is banished in his wickedness, But (Gen. 49:18; Job 13:15; (Ps. 16:11; 73:24); 2 Cor. 1:9; 5:8; (2 Tim. 4:18)) the righteous has a refuge in his death.
Wisdom rests in the heart of him who has understanding, But (Prov. 12:16) what is in the heart of fools is made known.
Righteousness exalts a (Prov. 11:11) nation, But sin is a reproach to any people.
(Matt. 24:45-47) The king’s favor is toward a wise servant, But his wrath is against him who causes shame.
A (Prov. 25:15) soft answer turns away wrath, But (1 Sam. 25:10) a harsh word stirs up anger.
The tongue of the wise uses knowledge rightly, (Prov. 12:23) But the mouth of fools pours forth foolishness.
(2 Chr. 16:9; Job 34:21; Prov. 5:21; Jer. 16:17; 32:19; Zech. 4:10; Heb. 4:13) The eyes of the LORD are in every place, Keeping watch on the evil and the good.
A wholesome tongue is a tree of life, But perverseness in it breaks the spirit.
(Prov. 10:1) A fool despises his father’s instruction, (Prov. 13:18) But he who receives correction is prudent.
In the house of the righteous there is much treasure, But in the revenue of the wicked is trouble.
The lips of the wise disperse knowledge, But the heart of the fool does not do so.
(Prov. 21:27; Eccl. 5:1; Is. 1:11; Jer. 6:20; Mic. 6:7) The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, But the prayer of the upright is His delight.
The way of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD, But He loves him who (Prov. 21:21) follows righteousness.
(1 Kin. 22:8) Harsh discipline is for him who forsakes the way, And (Prov. 5:12) he who hates correction will die.
(Job 26:6; Ps. 139:8) Hell and Destruction are before the LORD; So how much more (1 Sam. 16:7; 2 Chr. 6:30; Ps. 44:21; Acts 1:24) the hearts of the sons of men.
(Prov. 13:1; Amos 5:10; 2 Tim. 4:3) A scoffer does not love one who corrects him, Nor will he go to the wise.
(Prov. 12:25) A merry heart makes a cheerful countenance, But (Prov. 17:22) by sorrow of the heart the spirit is broken.
The heart of him who has understanding seeks knowledge, But the mouth of fools feeds on foolishness.
All the days of the afflicted are evil, (Prov. 17:22) But he who is of a merry heart has a continual feast.
(Ps. 37:16; Prov. 16:8; Eccl. 4:6; 1 Tim. 6:6) Better is a little with the fear of the LORD, Than great treasure with trouble.
(Prov. 17:1) Better is a dinner of herbs where love is, Than a fatted calf with hatred.
(Prov. 26:21) A wrathful man stirs up strife, But he who is slow to anger allays contention.
(Prov. 22:5) The way of the lazy man is like a hedge of thorns, But the way of the upright is a highway.
